posts.message:
Offering the bloodless sacrifice of the Lamb today for pregnant mothers, those suffering from anxiety and depression, and for the faithful departed and noticed the lovely reflection of the Agnus Dei (Lamb of God) reflected in the paten. A beautiful moment from God.
- Fr Jason+

ðŸš©1. St. PETER (64 AD) - crucified upside down in Rome 
- his remains are buried in St. Peter's Basilica, Vatican
. 
ðŸš©2. St. JAMES the Greater (45 AD) - stabbed with sword
- his remains are buried in St. James Cathedral, Compostela, Spain
. 
ðŸš©3. St. JAMES the Less (63 AD) - stoned to death
- his remains are buried in the Holy Apostles Basilica, Rome, Italy
. 
ðŸš©4. St. JUDE Thaddeus (72 AD) - filled with arrows
- his remains are buried in St. Peter's Basilica, Vatican
. 
ðŸš©5. St. PHILIP (54 AD) - crucified by soldiers
- his remains are buried in Church of the Dodici, Rome, Italy
. 
ðŸš©6. St. THOMAS (70 AD) - thrust with spears
- his remains are buried in St. Thomas Cathedral, Mylapore, India
. 
ðŸš©7. St. SIMON the Zealot (74 AD) - stabbed with sword
- his remains are buried in the Altar of Crucifixion, Vatican
. 
ðŸš©8. St. BARTHOLOMEW (70 AD) - he was crucified
- his remains are buried in St. Bartholomew Church, Rome, Italy
. 
ðŸš©9. St. ANDREW (70 AD) - crucified in "X" shape Cross
- his remains are buried in Cathedral of Amalfi, Italy
. 
ðŸš©10. St. MATTHEW (60 AD) - he was crucified
- his remains are buried in St. Matthew Cathedral, Messina, Sicily
. 
ðŸš©11. St. JOHN (95 AD) - he died a natural death
- his remains are buried in St. John Basilica, Ephesus, Turkey
. 
ðŸš©12. St. MATHIAS (70 AD) - he was hanged on a cross
- his remains are buried in St. Mathias Abbey, Trier, Germany
. 
(St. Mathias was the replacement of Judas Iscariot who committed suicide after betraying Christ) 
. 
ðŸš©13. St. PAUL - was beheaded in Rome
- his remains are buried in St. Paul's Church, Rome, Italy. 
(Paul was not part of the original 12 apostles who were personally selected by Christ. He was a convert to Christianity and is considered as the Apostle to the Gentiles)
Mary Cassar Obituary - Visitation & Funeral Information
